result.execSummary:
The defendant Montreal J Bully was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Montreal J Bully in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Montreal J Bully in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction CONCURRENT to any sentence with credit for 18 days served.

Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 03-24-2017 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Court ordered the defendant to submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
Appeal rights given.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Montreal J Bully in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Montreal J Bully in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: sm  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 04.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  

Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Montreal J Bully

Prior: 2442 North 39th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
